intro: Serratula heterophylla, commonly known as the variable sow-thistle, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes and sizes. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and the plant is often considered a weed in agricultural settings. Serratula heterophylla has a taproot and is known for its rapid growth and adaptability to different environmental conditions.
